content.name: info_plate.png

The channel information is automatically displayed on the Info plate when changing channels.[CR][CR]1. CURRENT CHANNEL NUMBER AND NAME : Displays current TV/Radio channel number and name.[CR]2. EPG DATA : Press the DOWN button then press the LEFT/RIGHT button to view previous/next EPG.[CR]3. PROGRESS BAR : Displays programme start time, end time and progress bar.[CR]4. FUNCTION BUTTONS : Extended Information, Teletext, Subtitle, Start/Stop Recording, Mute and A/V Setting.
pip.png

PIP (Picture in picture) is a function that allows you to watch two programmes simultaneously.[CR]Some tips to remember when using PIP are as follow.[CR][CR]- Engage the PIP feature by pressing BLUE button on the remote; a small box should appear in one corner of the screen.[CR]- Change the channel in the PIP window by pressing number keys on the remote after turning Num Lock on.[CR]- Audio only comes from the main viewing screen.[CR]- You can also access and use the PIP while you are watching video in XBMC.
first_installation.png

When powering on your product for the first time after purchase, the First Installation will operate automatically.[CR][CR]- LANGUAGE SETUP : You can select the language in which the menu would be displayed.[CR]- VIDEO and AUDIO SETUP : You can configure the video and audio output settings here.[CR]- ANTENNA and SATELLITE SETUP : You can select the antenna and LNB settings for channel searching.[CR]- CHANNEL SEARCH SETUP : Here, you can scan the configured satellites to search new TV/Radio channels.[CR]- TIME and DATE SETUP : You should set your local time for timer events.
antenna_setup.png

1. DISEQC 1.0 : It allows multiple antennas to be connected to the STB simultaneously. You can connect up to 4 satellites.[CR]2. DISEQC 1.1 : It allows you to connect up to 64 different satellites.[CR]3. MOTORIZED DISEQC 1.2 : You can set the position of your desired satellites if you have a motorized antenna.[CR]4. MOTORIZED USALS : You can set the motor antenna for efficient channel search in USALS.[CR]5. SIMPLE LNB : It is used when only one satellite is connected.
channel_search.png
1. AUTOMATIC SCAN : It is for general users and the easiest way to search channels.[CR]2. MANUAL SCAN : This is more appropriate if you know which satellites you want to search and their parameters.
delete_channels.png

You can delete, move, select, rename or lock the channels conveniently in the Channel List window.[CR][CR]1. Press the i button to display the channel list context menu and select EDIT CHANNELS.[CR]2. Select the channels you want to delete by pressing OK button.[CR]3. Press the i button again and select DELETE and press OK button to delete the channels previously selected.[CR]4. Press SAVE AND EXIT on the context menu.[CR]5. When a message asking for confirmation will appear, press YES to save.
create_fav.png

The entire channels in the channel list are often too many to navigate. Sort the channels that you watch more often in a favorite channel group.[CR][CR]1. Select CREATE NEW FAVORITE GROUP on the channel list context menu and Press OK button.[CR]2. Enter a name for your favorite channel group.[CR]3. Press DONE to confirm.

page.title: Adding Channels to a Favorite Group

content.name: add_channels.png

1. Select channels you want to add to your favorite group[CR]2. Choose ADD TO FAVORITE GROUP on the context menu then press OK[CR]3. Select a group from the list of available favorite groups then press OK.

page.title: Removing Channels from a Favorite Group

content.name: remove_channels.png

1. Press the LEFT button on the remote control and select FAVORITE GROUPS.[CR]2. Select the group you want to remove channels from.[CR]3. Select the channels that you want to delete by pressing OK button.[CR]4. Select DELETE on the context menu to remove all the channels you have selected previously.
rename_fav.png

1. To display the channel list's context menu, press the i button.[CR]2. Select RENAME FAVORITE GROUP on the menu.[CR]3. Select the favorite group you want to rename and press OK.[CR]4. Enter a new name using the keypad.[CR]5. Press DONE to confirm.
delete_fav.png
1. Display the channel list's context menu by pressing the i button.[CR]2. Select DELETE FAVORITE GROUP on the menu.[CR]3. Select the favorite group you want to delete.[CR]4. Press OK to confirm.
xbmc.png

XBMC is an entertainment hub for digital media that can be used to play almost all popular audio and video formats from your hard drive. XBMC allows the user to install new add-ons like YouTube, Flickr, as well as skins from the repository installed.
install_addons.png

Add-ons are packages that add features and functions not normally included with XBMC.[CR][CR]1. Select PRISMCUBE'S ADD-ONS and press OK.[CR]2. Scroll down to the category you want and press OK.[CR]3. Select the add-on you want to install.[CR]4. A summary dialog will be brought up allowing you see various properties of the add-on.[CR]5. Select INSTALL to begin automatic downloading and installing.

page.title: Updating Add-ons
page.location: (MEDIA > ADD-ON MANAGER > PRESS LEFT or RIGHT BUTTON)

content.name: update_addons.png

All installed add-ons will be automatically updated when new versions are available from the repositories.[CR]If Auto update is turned off you should see a folder in the Add-on manager that says Available Updates, where you can go in and one-by-one and update add-ons.
addons.png

When the add-on has finished downloading, XBMC will enable it and depending on the add-on ask if you want to start using it. Add-ons will then appear in their appropriate section. ( e.g. Flickr in the pictures, YouTube in the video section of Media, etc )
